image.altText: Matt and Kaia leaving court

props.synopsis: The prosecution has finished its closing arguments in the trial of Matt Wright, with the defence expected to begin its closing address tomorrow before the jury starts deliberations.

title.children: Prosecution finishes closing arguments in Matt Wright trial

image.altText: The exterior of the local court in Darwin

props.synopsis: The NT Department of Infrastructure and Logistics has been fined $26,000 for destroying a sacred "lightning tree" during construction of a road near a remote Central Australian community.

title.children: NT department fined for destroying sacred tree during road construction

image.altText: The chief minister and other NT politicians walking outside of parliament house.

props.synopsis: One year ago, Lia Finocchiaro said her newly elected Northern Territory government would "do whatever it takes to restore community safety". How is it tracking on that election promise?

title.children: Crime reforms, overflowing prisons dominate NT government's first year

image.altText: A green and white solar-powered vehicle travelling on an outback road, the Devils Marbles rocks can be seen in the background.

props.synopsis: Solar-powered vehicles designed by university students from around the world have descended on the Northern Territory's remote outback, bringing a sense of science fiction to the sparse landscape as they race from Darwin to Adelaide.

title.children: Futuristic homemade cars zoom through the outback in the name of science

image.altText: outside a big imposing white court house

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal mother-of-two suffered years of "serial abuse" before she was violently attacked by her partner and left to die on a main road, an Alice Springs courtroom has heard.

title.children: Mother-of-two suffered years of 'serial abuse' before violent death

image.altText: A row of local council placards lined up outside a polling booth.

props.synopsis: Residents across the Northern Territory flocked to the polls to cast their vote in the NT local government elections over the weekend, with early results showing close contests in Darwin and Alice Springs.

title.children: Mayoral frontrunners emerge as NT local government vote count continues

image.altText: Two men play AFL.

props.synopsis: Laramba has defeated Western Aranda to take out the Central Australian Football League senior men's community competition in Alice Springs.

title.children: Roos triumph over Bulldogs in Alice Springs footy final

image.altText: Tony Burke speaks at a press conference at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke has dismissed Israel's claim it pressed Australia into expelling Iran's ambassador, after the government determined Iran was behind a number of antisemitic attacks on Australian soil. Follow live.

title.children: Iranian ambassador emerges from embassy as Burke says 'nonsense' for Israel claim to credit

image.altText: A Woolworths and BWS sign in Adelaide

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has risen, while individual stocks, including Woolworths, Domino's Pizza, Flight Centre and Tabcorp, have made major moves. Wall Street closed higher despite Donald Trump's decision to sack a Federal Reserve governor.

title.children: Woolworths shares plunge as supermarket earnings disappoint — as it happened

image.altText: A general view of the Australia Post Office with a man walking and a car on the road

props.synopsis: Many Australians and small businesses are scrambling for information as a Trump administration tariff on low-value packages looms.

title.children: Australia Post halts parcel deliveries to the US — so what if you need to send a package?

image.altText: Mitchell Brown looks to kick during an AFL game for the West Coast Eagles.

props.synopsis: Former AFL player Mitch Brown creates history by becoming the first person in the league's 129-year history to reveal he is bisexual.

title.children: Ex-West Coast defender Brown becomes AFL's first openly bisexual player

image.altText: A long queue of cars outside a petrol station

props.synopsis: Petrol shortages have been plaguing several regions in Russia, as Ukraine escalates its attacks on the country's oil refineries.

title.children: Russians complain of fuel shortages, high prices as Ukrainian strikes bite

image.altText: Bruce and Denise Morcombe in Hobart

props.synopsis: The state government will introduce legislation to parliament on Wednesday to establish the registry, which will be named Daniel's Law in honour of Daniel Morcombe.

title.children: Misuse of Daniel's Law sex offender registry to carry 10-year sentence

image.altText: Woman with sunglasses on head.

props.synopsis: A judges dismiss an appeal against the sentence handed to domestic violence murderer Tyrone Thompson, which was described by the Crown as "manifestly inadequate".

title.children: Mother sobs after appeal against sentence for DV murderer fails

image.altText: A man in a black shirt holds a woman wearing a black and white dress in a warm embrace in a flower-filled garden

props.synopsis: The superstar couple revealed the news in a joint post on Instagram.

title.children: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce announce engagement

image.altText: A stand off between a lion and a cobra

props.synopsis: An inquisitive pack of wolves and a stand-off between two dangerous animals are among the highly commended images in this year's Wildlife Photographer of the Year competition.

title.children: The highly commended images from the Wildlife Photographer of the Year

image.altText: A street with about four cars on it

props.synopsis: Residents are frustrated as another WA local government is thrust into the spotlight for mismanagement claims.

title.children: WA local government dysfunction in spotlight as councils dissolve

image.altText: Rangers and police surround a tent

props.synopsis: City of Moreton Bay council says it has spent $1.4 million enforcing homelessness policies after making homeless camping illegal in March.

title.children: Council spends more than $1m on 'illegal' homeless camps crackdown

image.altText: A man sits on the steps leading to his front door, posing for a photo, holding a photograph

props.synopsis: Family members who have found out specimens from their loved ones' bodies had been retained by a pathology museum without consent are waiting for the coroner's investigation to finish before they decide what their next steps will be.

title.children: Devastated families may take legal action over museum that kept body parts

image.altText: A picture of a camera and backpack on stairs next a persons legs covered in dust an rubble

props.synopsis: The IDF report into the strikes which killed 20 people, among them five journalists, says troops targeted a camera set up by Hamas but doesn't provide evidence for that claim.

title.children: Israel's Gaza hospital strike inquiry fails to acknowledge second attack

image.altText: Tony Burke in front of flags.

props.synopsis: Australia is currently seeking to resettle three people released as a result of the landmark "NZYQ" High Court decision on the tiny island nation in exchange for an undisclosed fee, but their removal has been stalled since February due to court challenges.

title.children: Government moves to bolster powers to deport non-citizens to Nauru

image.altText: Iga Swiatek smiles during a press conference at the US Open.

props.synopsis: Iga Świątek sets a new record as the greatest starter in tennis history, but the rarely effusive Pole lights up most when speaking about Taylor Swift's engagement to Travis Kelce.

title.children: Swiftie Świątek celebrates Taylor's engagement after record win

image.altText: Ryggs Johnston kisses the trophy after winning the Australian Open golf tournament.

props.synopsis: The winner of the men's Australian Open will be granted automatic entry into the Masters as part of a rare change to qualifying criteria by Augusta National.

title.children: 'Landmark moment' as Masters grants automatic entry to Aus Open winner

image.altText: A composite image of West Coast's Harley Reid and St Kilda's Nasaiah Wanganeen-Milera.

props.synopsis: Harley Reid has confounded the speculation with his decision to stay in the west, but for players like him and Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera, the ferocious media spotlight is never likely to abate.

title.children: Harley and Nasiah's mega-deals only pause AFL's descent into new media world

image.altText: An image of the Big Four Australian banks ATMs side by side

props.synopsis: A 32-year-old Broken Hill man is arrested after more than $700,000 in cash is unaccounted-for from ATMs in the area. Police allege he accessed a portion of the money through his employment.

title.children: More than $700k in cash missing from multiple Broken Hill ATMs

image.altText: A man with short hair, sunglasses on top of his head, and wearing a grey t-shirt stands under a verandah, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Police release CCTV of a car thought to be involved in a fatal hit-and-run in northern NSW.

title.children: Car identified in hit-and-run death of beloved family man

image.altText: A golden egg in a nest symbolising superannuation.

props.synopsis: Consumers are being urged to make "binding" death benefit nominations to avoid lengthy legal disputes between family members and loved ones. Here's what you need to do to make sure your wishes are followed.

title.children: Who can inherit your superannuation? How can you make sure they get it?

image.altText: Axl Raven as a boy with his arm about his mother Natasha Raven. Both are smiling.

props.synopsis: Sixteen-year-old Axl misses his mum Natasha Raven every day, but says a prison sentence for the man who killed her in a drunken hit-and-run provides him some relief.

title.children: Son of woman killed by drink driver says 'justice served' by jail term

image.altText: A teenage boys with glasses puts on a face mask out in a garden

props.synopsis: Five months after the algal bloom was first detected on the Fleurieu Peninsula, residents along parts of the SA coast say it is continuing to impact their physical and mental health, with a new survey revealing feelings of worry and anxiety.

title.children: Along SA's coastal frontline, the algal bloom is continuing to impact residents

image.altText: Two women looking sad holding a framed photo of a man.

props.synopsis: Renee Santos says her father waited for three months at Wollongong Hospital for a bed in a residential aged care facility. About 830 people are waiting in New South Wales hospitals for aged care beds to become available.

title.children: Wait for aged care bed destroyed my dying dad's dignity, daughter says

image.altText: A motocross rider riding a motorbike on a dirt track doing a wheelie.

props.synopsis: Jett and Hunter Lawrence have finished first and second in the American Motocross 450cc Championship, and motocross clubs say they are inspiring juniors back home.

title.children: 'Unstoppable' Aussie brothers dominate American motocross

image.altText: Alex de Minaur serves at the US Open.

props.synopsis: Australians Alexei Popyrin and Maya Joint enjoy their return to the US Open a year after famous wins at Flushing Meadows.

title.children: Alex de Minaur wins all-Aussie clash to kick off US Open campaign

image.altText: Box culvert under road with construction fencing around it

props.synopsis: A stoush between major property developers Lendlease and Stockland delays the construction of a purpose-built koala underpass south of Sydney.

title.children: Developer impasse halts work on underpass at koala roadkill hotspot
